required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rates of Apnea in Patients Undergoing Vitreoretinal Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Rates of Apnea in Patients Undergoing Vitreoretinal Surgery

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine if apnea (the stopping of breathing) occurs in patients undergoing undergoing monitored anesthesia care (MAC) for vitreoretinal surgery

detailed_description.textblock: Patients undergoing vitreoretinal surgery will be monitored during the procedure to determine if they stop breathing. This study is observational in nature and no interventions will be made.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.description: Determine if patients undergoing vitreoretinal surgery under monitored anesthesia care stop breathing during the procedure

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing vitreoretinal surgery under monitored anesthesia care. They will be observed during surgery and no interventions will be administered.

study_pop.textblock: patients having vitreoretinal surgery under monitored anesthesia care

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients having vitreoretinal surgery under monitored anesthesia care
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients having vitreoretinal surgery without monitored anesthesia care
